roleset.name: cause motion by air current
roleset.note: BLOW-N NOTES: Roleset based on verb entry blow.01, OntoNotes grouping blow-n sense 5; maps to VN class split-23.2. Framed by Claire. (from blow.02-n)

example.name: ergative intransitive
example.text: Battle-tested Japanese industrial managers here always buck up nervous newcomers with the tale of the first of their countrymen to visit Mexico , [a boatload]-3 of samurai warriors blown *trace*-3 ashore 375 years ago.

example.name: Arg0,1,DIR
example.text: The wind's blowing his kite into the treetops saddened little Jiminy.

example.name: MNR, Arg1
example.text: The coach gave three sharp blows on his whistle to stop the play.

example.name: All arguments
example.text: The soldier's blow of the bugle announced reverie.

example.name: ArgM's only
example.text: Give your nose a good blow into this handkerchief.

example.name: Arg 0 as possessor
example.text: You are knocked back by the painful force of the wind's blow!

role.descr: recipient, what stuff was wasted on

example.name: Sunday hangover
example.text: I blew 100 dollars on scotch at the bar last night.

example.name: Arg0,1,2
example.text: Jefferey's blowing his whole paycheck at the dog track lead to his having to eat only Ramen for the next two weeks.

roleset.name: create, shape by blowing air
roleset.note: BLOW-V NOTES: Perhaps also "John blew his soup cooler." If you can say that at all. (from blow.02-v)

role.descr: end state, if different from arg1

example.name: all args
example.text: John blew the molten glass into a delicate bottle.

example.name: Arg0,1,2
example.text: Benny's blowing the molten glass into delicate unicorns always impressed the tourists.

example.name: you were waiting for it
example.text: John....oh, never mind.

example.name: intransitive
example.text: The wind was blowing against them

roleset.name: explode, explosion
roleset.note: BLOW-V NOTES: I don't think this can take any other args, unlike the corresponding'explode' sense of 'blow up'. (from blow.08-v)
BLOW-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT, blow-v.08. No VNcls. (from blow.08-n)

roles.note: Arg2 may be a little awkward with this nominalization, but we'll see. (from blow.08-n)

role.descr: entity damaged, damage caused by explosion

example.name: unaccusative
example.text: One local Phillips manager said a seal blew in one of the plant's reactors.
example.arg: in one of the plant's reactors

example.name: With cause, colloquial
example.text: This blows my mind .

example.name: explosion and damage
example.text: 17 sailors were killed and dozens were injured when-2 the explosion blew a huge hole into the hull of the Navy destroyer as it was refueling in Aden *T*-2.
example.arg: a huge hole into the hull of the Navy destroyer as it w
as it was refueling in Aden

example.name: Arg1
example.text: A seal blowing in one of the reactors alerted personnel to the possible leak.

example.name: ewwww. arg1
example.text: The normal person would get colon blow from these doses , and it firms me up to normal .

example.name: transitive
example.text: But unlike London, out here I've never heard anybody blow a car horn in anger.

example.name: also ergative
example.text: John heard the trumpets blow and the drums beat.

example.name: Arg0,1
example.text: Motorists blowing the horns in frustration surprisingly did not cause the traffic jam to dissolve.

example.name: oops, I did it again
example.text: ``I blew it,'' Mr. Motley says apologetically.

example.name: Arg0,1
example.text: His blowing it with the Chauncey account got Leonard fired.

roleset.name: suck, be bad
roleset.note: BLOW-V NOTES: Based on Bolt SMS data. No comparison. No VN or FN classes. Framed by Katie. (from blow.13-v)

example.text: That blows!

roleset.name: strike
roleset.note: BLOW-N NOTES: Roleset based on OntoNotes grouping blow-n senses 1& 2, no relevant PB verb entry, no relevant mapping to VN. Framed by Claire. (from blow.01-n)

roles.note: Be careful to distinguish instruments from agents. (from blow.01-n)

role.descr: instrument, thing hit by or with

example.name: NP only, args 0, 1 TMP
example.text: a fourth-quarter blow to earnings from the California earthquake

example.name: Arg 0 only
example.text: The boxer crumpled to the ground from the continuous blows of his opponent.

example.name: Args 0 & 1
example.text: This crater is the result of a blow to the earth's surface by a meteor.

example.name: Arg 1 only -- pre relational position
example.text: The country struggled to recover after a series of economic blows.

example.name: All arguments
example.text: The speaker's broad swinging motion depicts the woodsman's effort in delivering his blow to the wolf with the hatchet.

roleset.name: inflate
roleset.note: BLOW_UP-V NOTES: I doubt the higher numbered args will appear. Or I could be wrong. (from blow.05-v)

role.descr: amount increased by, EXT or MNR
end point, end state of arg1

example.name: balloons
example.text: ``[The balloon]-2 had been blown *trace*-2 up so big that when somebody came along with a pin -- in this case the UAL deal -- we got a little pop.''
example.arg: so big that when somebody came along with a pin -- in this case the UAL deal -- we got a little pop

example.name: Arg0,1
example.text: His blowing up the balloons for the part was interrupted by a stampede of sheep through the courtyard.

example.name: ergative boom
example.text: Last week, the strategy of playing the two experts off each other blew up.
example.arg: the strategy of playing the two experts off each other

example.name: agentive
example.text: The representative responded that Noriega had numerous assets in place in Nicaragua and could accomplish many essential things, just as [Noriega]-1 had helped the U.S. the previous year in *trace*-1 blowing up a Sandinista arsenal.''

example.name: with instrument
example.text: John blew up the anthill with a firecracker.

example.name: Arg0,1
example.text: His blowing up the treehouse marked the beginning of his criminally destructive behavior.

example.name: boom
example.text: The blasts blew out windows, spewed debris for miles and crumpled the ceiling in an area elementary school.

example.name: also ergative
example.text: A company official said the explosions began when a seal blew out.

example.name: Exploding air
example.text: The explosion's blowing out all the windows in the building drew the attention of everybody on the street.
example.arg: all the windows in the building

roleset.name: pass
roleset.note: BLOW_OVER-V NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT. No VNcls. (from blow.12-v)

example.name: the arg
example.text: A downtown bar crawl may be something to avoid for the next six months or so -LRB- until this thing blows over -RRB- but bar crawls after legislative sessions -LRB- city or state -RRB- have been part of the elected - office scene since the founding of the state .
